intro: Corymbis leptantha, commonly known as the slender-leaf corymbis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its botanical features include elongated, lance-shaped leaves and a distinct, branched inflorescence. Corymbis leptantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine.
